page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: In the late seventies the centre of Stokeinteignhead was made a conservation area. The aim was to preserve the essential character of the village. New buildings have been permitted and others converted so that the village can remain 'alive' and not become a museum. When in l982 the village school was reroofed the old slates were replaced by artificial slates so that the character of the building was retained. Many buildings still retain thatched roofs although insurance premiums for such buildings are very high.
